arm_group.description: One educational session in group, and 10 individual sessions of manual lymphatic drainage in lower extremity, during approximately one month.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to compare functional status and quality of life of a group of
      patients with chronic venous insufficiency treated with manual lymphatic drainage with a
      group not treated with manual lymphatic drainage.

      Investigators hypothesized that manual lymphatic drainage can improve:

        -  quality of life,

        -  functional status,

        -  calf muscle strength,

        -  ankle range of motion,

        -  edema,

        -  severity of disease,

        -  and symptoms.

clinical_study.brief_title: Manual Lymphatic Drainage in Chronic Venous Insufficiency: a Randomized Controlled Trial

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Diagnose of chronic venous insufficiency class C3-5 for
             Clinical-Etiological-Anatomical-Pathological classification (CEAP).

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Severe cardiac insufficiency,

          -  Acute venous or arterial obstruction,

          -  Arterial insufficiency, renal insufficiency,

          -  Uncompensated thyroid dysfunction,

          -  Pregnancy, neoplastic pathology,

          -  Systemic or limb infection,

          -  Recent musculoskeletal injury in the lower limb,

          -  Peripheral neuropathy in the lower limb.

facility.name: Escola Superior de Saúde Dr. Lopes Dias

clinical_study.official_title: Manual Lymphatic Drainage in Chronic Venous Insufficiency: a Randomized Controlled Trial

primary_outcome.description: Evaluated by portuguese version of Chronic Venous Disease Quality of Life Questionnaire (CIVIQ-2).
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline (no intervention), after approximately one month, with an error of three days (10 sessions of manual lymphatic drainage, for experimental group) and after approximately two months from baseline (with an error of 5 days)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline (no intervention), after approximately one month, with an error of three days (10 sessions of manual lymphatic drainage, for experimental group) and after approximately two months from baseline (with an error of 5 days).

secondary_outcome.description: With Visual Analogue Scale was assessed: pain, fatigue, heaviness, itching, sKin irritation, cramps and other.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline (no intervention), after approximately one month, with an error of three days (10 sessions of manual lymphatic drainage, for experimental group) and after approximately two months from baseline (with an error of 5 days).

secondary_outcome.description: Venous reflux and anterograde flow during manual leg compression, by duplex ultrasound in femoral vein, great saphenous vein, popliteal vein and small saphenous vein.
secondary_outcome.measure: Hemodynamic evidence of severity of chronic venous disease
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline (no intervention), after approximately one month, with an error of three days (10 sessions of manual lymphatic drainage, for experimental group) and after approximately two months from baseline (with an error of 5 days).

secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by Venous Clinical Severity Score.
secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical severity of chronic venous insufficiency
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline (no intervention), after approximately one month, with an error of three days (10 sessions of manual lymphatic drainage, for experimental group) and after approximately two months from baseline (with an error of 5 days).

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluated by Biodex system 3 pro isokinetic dynamometer.
secondary_outcome.measure: Calf muscle strength and ankle range of motion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at aseline (no intervention), after approximately one month, with an error of three days (10 sessions of manual lymphatic drainage, for experimental group) and after approximately two months from baseline (with an error of 5 days)

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluated by Portuguese version of Functional Status Questionnaire (FSQ).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at aseline (no intervention), after approximately one month, with an error of three days (10 sessions of manual lymphatic drainage, for experimental group) and after approximately two months from baseline (with an error of 5 days)
